tumor_size_max_dimension_evidence: Final Diagnosis section states squamous cell carcinoma measuring 4.2 cm in greatest dimension in left lingula resection specimen.
pT_evidence: Tumor size is 4.2 cm and visceral pleura is not involved. According to AJCC 7th edition, tumor >3 cm but â‰¤5 cm without visceral pleura invasion is T2a.
pN_evidence: Multiple ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph nodes (levels 5, 6, 7, 3, 4) show metastatic carcinoma; 13 nodes positive consistent with N2 category.
tumor_stage_evidence: AJCC 7th edition staging: T2a N2 Mx corresponds to Stage IIIA lung cancer.
histologic_diagnosis_evidence: Final Diagnosis states poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma in left lingula lung specimen.
comment: The pathology report describes a poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma of the left lingula measuring 4.2 cm with lymphovascular invasion but no visceral pleura involvement. Multiple ipsilateral mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are positive for metastatic carcinoma, consistent with N2 disease. The rib specimen shows no tumor involvement. Margins are uninvolved by invasive carcinoma. Based on AJCC 7th edition criteria, the tumor is staged as T2a N2 Mx, corresponding to Stage IIIA. The report is comprehensive with detailed lymph node assessment and margin evaluation. No distant metastasis information is provided (Mx). The tumor size and nodal status are well documented, supporting a confident staging. The presence of lymphovascular invasion and multiple positive lymph nodes indicates aggressive disease requiring multidisciplinary management.
